events.message: Customer reported a vehicle accident involving a collision at an intersection. Request to open a new claim.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' due to the involvement of customer's car in a collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim and communicate with the customer.
Customer received official acknowledgment from insurance informing that their auto accident claim is being processed.
Customer was requested to submit the police report, photos of the car damage, and a statement describing the accident.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report, pictures from the accident scene, and insurance card.
Investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and vehicle condition to assess the circumstances of the accident.
Investigation concluded with verification of fault and assessment of repair costs for the damaged vehicle sustained in collision.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on investigation results and insurance policy coverage.
Customer provided positive feedback on prompt communication and transparency regarding the settlement proposal.
The claim was formally approved, authorizing payment based on the agreed settlement amount for vehicle repairs.
Payment was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s repair shop covering the costs agreed upon in the settlement.
The auto accident claim was closed after payment and all required documentation were completed and confirmed.
The finalized claim file was archived securely in compliance with company data retention policies.
